meanings.definition: A distinct part of a larger organization or system
meanings.sent1: In our school, the math and science departments work together to create a well-rounded curriculum.
meanings.sent2: The marketing department is responsible for promoting the company's products and services.
meanings.sent3: The art department and the music department had a friendly competition to see who could create the best holiday decorations.
meanings.sent4: The departments of the company are like puzzle pieces, each fitting perfectly to make the whole picture complete.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the bustling departments of the hospital, I could see the dedication and hard work of the staff.

meanings.definition: A division of a larger organization or institution
meanings.sent1: The IT department at the university is always available to help students with their technical issues.
meanings.sent2: Each department of the museum focuses on a different period of art history.
meanings.sent3: The department of superheroes at the costume store was always the busiest on Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The department of astronomy explores the vast mysteries of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The department of transportation ensures the smooth flow of traffic in the city.

meanings.definition: A section of a government or business dealing with a specific function
meanings.sent1: The finance department of the company handles all the budgeting and financial planning.
meanings.sent2: The health department works tirelessly to protect the well-being of the community.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream department at the grocery store always has the longest line on hot summer days.
meanings.sent4: The customer service department strives to provide excellent support to all clients.
meanings.sent5: The education department is dedicated to ensuring every student has access to quality learning opportunities.
